dfischer.utils

Class ZipArchive

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ZipArchive

  • public class ZipArchive
extends java.lang.Object
    Create, read and write zip archives. All data are kept in memory. Note: this class stores only plain file names in zip archives, meaning that stored file names do not contain disk paths and and that the zip archive itself contains no subdirectories. However, the zip archive can contain other zipped files or jar files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ZipArchive(java.lang.String zipArchiveFilePath)
      Creates a new instance in memory only which contains no data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZipArchive

        public ZipArchive(java.lang.String zipArchiveFilePath)
        Creates a new instance in memory only which contains no data. The calling of this constructor has no effect on the file system (no disk I/O).
        Parameters:
        zipArchiveFilePath - relative or absolute file path of the zip archive that has to be created or has to be read. Note: this parameter can also be null, meaning that the relative or absolute path file path of the zip archive can be defined later by calling the method setZipArchiveFilePath(String zipArchiveFilePath).
        See Also:
        read(), write()

    • Method Detail

      • setZipArchiveFilePath

        public void setZipArchiveFilePath(java.lang.String zipArchiveFilePath)
        Set a new relative or absolute file path of the zip archive that has to be created or has to be read. The calling of this method has no effect on the file system (no disk I/O).

      • getZipArchiveFilePath

        public java.lang.String getZipArchiveFilePath()
        Get the relative or absolute file path of the zip archive.
        Returns:
        the relative or absolute file path of the zip archive, as was passed to the constructor of this class, or as set by calling the method setZipArchiveFilePath(String zipArchiveFilePath).

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String zipEntryFilePath)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Add a file to the zip archive (stored in memory only). The data are not written on the file system (no disk I/O).
        Parameters:
        zipEntryFilePath - relative or absolute path of the file that has to be added. Note: absolute paths of files are stored in the zip archive as plain file names.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String plainFileNameInArchive,
       byte[] fileData)
        Add a file entry to the zip archive (stored in memory only). The data are not written on the file system (no disk I/O).
        Parameters:
        plainFileNameInArchive - the file name of the entry in the zip archive (plain file name without path)
        fileData - the file data of the entry in the zip archive

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String plainFileNameInArchive)
        Remove a file entry to from the zip archive (in memory only). The data if the zip archive are not written to the file system (no disk I/O).
        Parameters:
        plainFileNameInArchive - the file name of the entry in the zip archive to be removed (plain file name without path)
        See Also:
        getZipArchiveFileNames()

      • getZipArchiveFileNames

        public java.lang.String[] getZipArchiveFileNames()
        Get all (plain) file names of the zip archive entries.
        Returns:
        all (plain) file names of the zip archive entries, sorted by name (not case sensitive sorting)

      • getZipArchiveFileMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ZipArchiveFile> getZipArchiveFileMap()
        Get the zip archive as a hash map. Note: the returned map as well as the keys of the map are cloned.
        Returns:
        he zip archive as a hash map.

      • containsZipArchiveFileName

        public boolean containsZipArchiveFileName(java.lang.String plainFileNameInArchive)
        Check if a file already exists in the zip archive.
        Parameters:
        plainFileNameInArchive - plain file name of a supposed zip archive entry
        Returns:
        true the plain file name already exists in the zip archive

      • getZipArchiveFileData

        public byte[] getZipArchiveFileData(java.lang.String plainFileNameInArchive)
        Get the file data of a zip archive entry.
        Parameters:
        plainFileNameInArchive - plain file name of a zip archive entry
        Returns:
        the file data of a zip archive entry, or null if no entry with a corresponding file name exists in the zip archive

      • write

        public void write()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Write the zip archive to disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public void read()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Read a zip archive from disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

          throws java.io.IOException
        Read a zip archive from memory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
